noun.description: A highly contagious viral infection of the respiratory passages causing fever, severe aching, and catarrh, and often occurring in epidemics.

origin: Mid 18th century: from Italian, literally influence, from medieval Latin influentia (see influence). The Italian word also has the sense an outbreak of an epidemic, hence epidemic. It was applied specifically to an influenza epidemic which began in Italy in 1743, later adopted in English as the name of the disease.
